abstract: Plight of Jacqueline Kostyuchenko, disabled Brooklyn girl who attended Public School 321 in Park Slope, helped spur federal investigation that found 80 percent of New York City's school system in violation of Americans With Disabilities Act; Kostyuchenko fought uphill battle along with her family to succeed at school that was not wheelchair-accessible.
lead_paragraph: A federal investigation found that six of the city’s districts didn’t have a fully accessible school, forcing parents to lug children between classes or travel long distances to a sufficient school.

headline.main: Inquiry Shows Struggles of Disabled New York Students and Their Families
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Draws Attention to Obstacles Faced by Disabled Students and Their Families

snippet: A federal investigation found that six of the city’s districts didn’t have a fully accessible school, forcing parents to lug children between classes or travel long distances to a sufficient school.
